snippet: The charges against the reporter, Jason Rezaian of The Washington Post, are believed to carry a maximum penalty of 20 years in prison.
abstract: Washington Post correspondent Jason Rezaian, who has been in Iranian prison for nine months, is charged with four crimes including espionage and breaking law by writing to United States Pres Barack Obama; incarceration, interrogation and harsh treatment of Rezaian have added to tensions between US and Iran and are increasingly seen as intertwined with ongoing negotiations over Iran's nuclear program.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and THOMAS ERDBRINK

lead_paragraph: The charges against the reporter, Jason Rezaian of The Washington Post, are believed to carry a maximum penalty of 20 years in prison.

headline.main: Charges Against Jason Rezaian, Washington Post Reporter Held in Iran, Include Espionage
headline.print_headline: Charges Against Journalist Held in Iran Are Said to Include Espionage
